name: Hotel Baltschug Kempinski Moscow

reviews.text: We stayed for a weekend in this hotel. It's a great hotel for visiting Moscow. All the major attraction are within walking distance. The breakfast was incredible - the first time I saw salmon caviar in a buffet breakfast.
reviews.title: Great hotel, great location, incredible breakfast

reviews.text: Of course the prices are crazy-high! 14 euros for a bottle of still water in the loby is just an example.
reviews.title: Beyond Words!

reviews.text: The rooms were clean, spacious and well maintained.
reviews.title: Spotless service at the best loaction

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed here during my recent trip to Moscow and was amazed and impressed by every detail. The staff greeted me warmly and put me in a room with a fantastic view of the Kremlin. I needed some instructions on visiting the sights and enjoying some evening entertainment and the concierge desk arranged every detail perfectly.
reviews.title: Truly 5 * and accommodating to my special diet

reviews.text: With the exception of a specific club that I went to one night, I was able to walk everywhere. The hotel is also very close to the metro and easily accessible by public transportation from the airport. (Moscow cabs are very tricky and you have to negotiate your fare in advance.)
reviews.title: Expensive but location and quality great

reviews.text: Just few minutes walk from the Red Square is the luxury Baltschug Kempisky hotel. The rooms are fully equipped and quiet with an outstanding service. If you apply to GHA programme you can get free in-room wi-fi internet connection. Try to get a room overlooking the Saint Basil's Cathedral or you can enjoy the sight in the breakfast area.
reviews.title: Luxury at footsteps of Red Square

reviews.text: I had the wosrt experiance ever during my last stay.
reviews.title: Horrible!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First of all the hotel is terrible, old, with not friendly attitude of the staff.
reviews.title: Very Nice Hotel
Expensive, but the nicest hotel in Moscow
reviews.text: My reservation was done with a mistake, wrong room wich i had to wait for 2 hours!
TV not working, no hot water!!!! Very Noisy!!!!!!!!!
reviews.title: Top notch and perfect in ever way

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Baltschug is a in a brilliant position just across the Moscova from Red Square. If you are lucky enough to get a river view room you will see St Basils Cathedral and the walls of the Kremlin from your room. The hote is very well equipped with gym, bar, restaurants etc, but the actual cost of eating or drinking in this hotel is prohibitive - breakfast works out at about £51 per person, per day! A bottle of beer from the hotel bar is around £11, and we didn't ask about evening meals! Moscow is an expensive destination, but the Baltschug outdoes the city prices by quite a bit! In saying that, it is a pretty spectacular hotel to stay in and the staff are fantastic - so friendly and willling to help. The concierge service is brilliant and will be able to organise anything - from the Bolshoi to river trips.
reviews.title: Brilliant position, historic hotel

reviews.text: We got a very good offer of 3 nights for the price of 2 in a standard room. Unfortunately, the rooms were at the back of the hotel and were subject to the bells every monring at 9am from the cathedral at the back of the hotel. This did not detract from our holiday as we were up and about anyway. The bathrooms were very luxurious, complete with bidet and they supply you with a paper every day. All in all, if you get a good cost for it, I would highly recommend.
reviews.title: never again

reviews.text: What is good about this hotel is the location. 10 min walk to Kremlin and views from the room to the river Moscow. The rest does not fit high level Kempinsky standards. Service is very slow and not friendly. We arrived at 12pm to the bar and spend 35 (!) min waiting for cognac with tee. This city has better hotels for much less money.
reviews.title: Spellbinding view - great location!

reviews.text: and one of few places in Moscow where you can find good service! It's a big fun to have your breakfast overlooking red square and moscow river with some ships moving on it.
reviews.title: sehr zentral, aber teuer

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very polite personell, good food, free shoe polish service every night - you feel really comfortable there! Price is a bottleneck as it's at least double from what you usially pay for hotel like this in europe, but it's Moscow, Russia....
reviews.title: Luxury and Class

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As repeaters, my wife and I decided to spend our 5th wedding birthday in Baltschug Kempinski Hotel for 4 nights in July 2010. Upon arrival in the hotel, the smiling doorman came immediately to assist us with our baggages and a very friendly reception staff took over our check in, in an efficient way, coming with us to show our room on 7th floor. We initially booked a Superior room, but were very positively surprised to see our room being upgraded into the Studio room number 707, with full view on Red Square, Kremlin and Cathedral St Basile, it was our first big surprise !
reviews.title: BEST MANAGEMENT, BEST LOCATION, BEST SERVICE EVER SEEN IN MOSCOW !!!

reviews.text: During check in, the excellent Director of Rooms, Mr Marcus SCHOLZ, came to greet us and to present himself. Mr SCHOLZ is a young, very professional and high class member of the Management team of the hotel.
reviews.title: Perfect location, good and confortable hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The service provided by the hotel staff was really excellent, all our special requests were fully satisfied. The SPA is awesome, very clean, quiet and provide free bottle of water, towel on request. Water of the swimming pool shows 30 degres Celsius and water of the jaccuzzi shows 40 degres Celsius (a little bit hot...). Security is also great, you need your room key to access the lift and the SPA, there are video and gards looking at every person entering the hotel, so you really feel secure inside this hotel.
reviews.title: Very little atmosphere, charged for everything
Lovely, lovely, lovely!
reviews.text: To resume :
Positive points :
reviews.title: Great Hotel

description: Experience the best view over the Kremlin and Moscow river from your hotel room. Located in the Moscow city center, in 5 minutes walk from the historical St.Basil’s Cathedral and Red Square the hotel offers 230 deluxe rooms and suites decorated by the best European designers and equipped with a minibar, CD/DVD player, satellite TV, telephone, electronic safe, individually controlled air conditioning. The hotel celebrates 20 years in 2012 and opens new facilities after an extensive renovation. New restaurant Baltschug Grill has an open kitchen and serve European and Russian, Cafe Kranzler is a Vienna-style cafe in the daytime and an evening lounge at night. Bar Lobby feature light snacks and cocktails as well as a special vodka menu. The Health Club, complimentary to hotel guests, offers a ladies’ and gents sauna, whirlpool, swimming pool and gym, massage and solarium are at additional charge. Additional complimentary services for hotel guests: mineral water in room replenished daily, Internet, shoe shine service overnight, access to the Baltschug Health Club, daily Russian/Enlglish newspaper.
